thread.title: What’s up with Sam and Jen?
thread.title_full: What’s up with Sam and Jen? | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Jojo Panaligan
title: What’s up with Sam and Jen?
text:
by Jojo Panaligan
October 15, 2015 When Bulletin Entertainment asked “The Prenup” lead stars Jennylyn Mercado and Sam Milby to take a picture of themselves right after the premiere night of the movie held at SM Megamall on Tuesday, the two had on self-conscious smiles as onlookers cajoled him to pull her closer.
Sam Milby and Jennylyn Mercado
Indeed, after working together in the movie not only here but in New York, they have developed chemistry which fans hope would transcend the silver screen. Based on moviegoers’ reaction seeing them together in scenes shot in Central Park, Times Square, etc., they make a lovely pair if fate steps in.
Jennylyn and Sam in ‘The Prenup’
Isn’t that also up to Sam, we asked. He turned red. We suggested that they guest on each other’s album for recording soon. The two said if it were just up to them, they’d do it in a heartbeat. At the very least, Sam said they plan to work out together.
Produced by Regal Entertainment and currently in theaters, “The Prenup” is a feel-good movie about two people who fell in love abroad only to have their families bicker over their planned wedding. When a prenup between the two was laid on the table, love and loyalties are put to the test.
“The Prenup” is Jennylyn’s first movie after winning Best Actress for “English Only, Please.” The movie is Sam’s first in a long while since he devoted some time studying acting in the US. This is their first movie together.
Also in the cast are Melai Cantiveros, Ella Cruz, Dominic Ochoa, Jaclyn Jose, Gardo Versoza, Freddie Webb and Neil Coleta. “The Prenup” is directed by Jun Robles Lana. (By Jojo P. Panaligan)
